org.bonitasoft.engine.api

Interface PlatformAPI

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    PlatformAPI

    public interface PlatformAPI
    Manage the platform.

    The platform is the base on which runs the engine.
    It mainly handles the creation of tables in database and also allow to start/stop a Node which is the current Virtual machine on which runs the engine. There is only one platform for a running Bonita Engine.

    Author:
    Elias Ricken de Medeiros, Lu Kai, Zhang Bole, Matthieu Chaffotte, Emmanuel Duchastenier

    • Method Detail

      • createPlatform

        void createPlatform()
                    throws CreationException
        Create the platform.

        The platform creation is done in 3 steps:

        • Creation of the persistence structure: tables are created
        • Initialization of persistence structure: index are added, default values and so on
        • The platform state is persisted
        Throws:
        InvalidSessionException - occurs if the API session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
        CreationException - occurs when an exception is thrown during platform creation

      • initializePlatform

        void initializePlatform()
                        throws CreationException
        Initialize the platform. The running environment of Bonita Engine is initialized and marked as activated.
        Business elements linked to the execution are initialized, after this step the technical user will be able to connect to the engine and to import the organization. No user are created by default and the default username/password to connect to the Bonita Engine are stored in the file bonita-platform.properties that is in the Bonita home.
        Throws:
        InvalidSessionException - occurs if the API session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
        CreationException - occurs when an exception is thrown during platform creation

      • createAndInitializePlatform

        void createAndInitializePlatform()
                                 throws CreationException
        Utilitary method that call createPlatform() and initializePlatform()
        Throws:
        InvalidSessionException - occurs if the API session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
        CreationException - occurs when an exception is thrown during platform creation
        See Also:
        createPlatform(), initializePlatform()

      • startNode

        void startNode()
               throws StartNodeException
        Starts the node.

        The node is the currently Java Virtual Machine on which Bonita Engine is running

        Starting the node make the Scheduler service to start and restart elements that were not finished by the Work service on the previous shutdown.

        Throws:
        InvalidSessionException - occurs if API Session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
        StartNodeException - occurs when an exception is thrown during the activation of the node

      • stopNode

        void stopNode()
              throws StopNodeException
        Stops the node.

        The node is the currently Java Virtual Machine on which Bonita Engine is running

        Stopping the node make the Scheduler service to stop.

        Throws:
        InvalidSessionException - occurs if API Session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
        StopNodeException - occurs when an exception is thrown during the stop of the node

      • cleanPlatform

        void cleanPlatform()
                   throws DeletionException
        Clean the platform.

        Empty all execution informations, i.e. database tables are cleaned and a new execution environment can be initialized.

        /!\Please remember that all data will be DELETED/!\

        This method does the opposite of initializePlatform()

        Throws:
        InvalidSessionException - Generic exception thrown if API Session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
        DeletionException - occurs when an exception is thrown during platform deletion
        See Also:
        initializePlatform()

      • deletePlatform

        void deletePlatform()
                    throws DeletionException
        Delete the platform

        This method delete the platform, i.e. all the database tables.

        Throws:
        InvalidSessionException - Generic exception thrown if API Session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
        DeletionException - occurs when an exception is thrown during platform deletion
        See Also:
        createPlatform()

        See Also:

        Throws:

        DeletionException - occurs when an exception is thrown during platform deletion
        See Also:

      • getPlatform

        Platform getPlatform()
                     throws PlatformNotFoundException
        Get the platform.
        Returns:
        the Platform object
        Throws:
        InvalidSessionException - Generic exception thrown if API Session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
        PlatformNotFoundException - occurs when the identifier does not refer to an existing platform

      • isPlatformCreated

        boolean isPlatformCreated()
                          throws PlatformNotFoundException
        Check if the platform created or not.
        Returns:
        true if the platform existed
        Throws:
        InvalidSessionException - Generic exception thrown if API Session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
        PlatformNotFoundException - occurs when the identifier does not refer to an existing platform

      • getPlatformState

        PlatformState getPlatformState()
                               throws PlatformNotFoundException
        Get the state of the platform of the current node
        Returns:
        PlatformState.STARTED or PlatformState.STOPPED depending on the scheduler state
        Throws:
        InvalidSessionException - Generic exception thrown if API Session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
        PlatformNotFoundException - occurs when the identifier does not refer to an existing platform

      • isNodeStarted

        boolean isNodeStarted()
        Is the current node started?
        Returns:
        true if the node is started, false if not started or if its state cannot be determined.
        Since:
        6.1

      • rescheduleErroneousTriggers

        void rescheduleErroneousTriggers()
                                 throws UpdateException
        Reschedules triggers which are in error state.
        Throws:
        UpdateException - If an exception occurs during the scheduling
        Since:
        6.2
